perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, Seller and Verso Technologies, Inc., a Minnesota corporation ("Buyer"), have entered into that certain Asset Purchase Agreement, dated as of the date hereof (the "Asset Purchase Agreement"), pursuant to which Buyer has the right to acquire the Purchased Assets of Seller and its Subsidiaries, as more particularly described in the Asset Purchase Agreement (all capitalized words and terms used herein and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Asset Purchase Agreement); and
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, Seller and Verso Technologies, Inc., a Minnesota corporation ("Client"), have entered into that certain Asset Purchase Agreement, dated as of the date hereof (the "Asset Purchase Agreement"), pursuant to which Buyer has the right to acquire the Purchased Assets of Seller and its Subsidiaries, as more particularly described in the Asset Purchase Agreement (all capitalized words and terms used herein and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Asset Purchase Agreement); and
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Buyer' is replaced with 'Client'. Throughout the rest of the document, the term 'Buyer' is still used. It is unclear if 'Client' refers to 'Buyer', creating confusion regarding which entity has the right to acquire assets.

perturbation.original_text: Seller hereby covenants and agrees, that from time to time forthwith upon the reasonable written request of Backhaul or Buyer, that Seller will, at Backhaul's cost and expense, do, execute, acknowledge and deliver or cause to be done, executed, acknowledged and delivered, each and all of such further acts, deeds, assignments, transfers, conveyances and assurances as may reasonably be required by Backhaul or Buyer in order to transfer, assign, convey and deliver unto and vest in Backhaul title to all right, title and interest of Seller in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text: Seller hereby covenants and agrees, that from time to time forthwith upon the reasonable written request of Backhaul or Customer, that Seller will, at Backhaul's cost and expense, do, execute, acknowledge and deliver or cause to be done, executed, acknowledged and delivered, each and all of such further acts, deeds, assignments, transfers, conveyances and assurances as may reasonably be required by Backhaul or Buyer in order to transfer, assign, convey and deliver unto and vest in Backhaul title to all right, title and interest of Seller in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Buyer' is replaced with 'Customer' in the middle of the clause but also keeps the word 'Buyer' in the same sentence. This introduces uncertainty as to whether 'Customer' is the same as 'Buyer' or Backhaul and who Seller is obligated to respond to. Since the original text defines Backhaul and Buyer, but not Customer, this creates confusion about the parties' responsibilities and rights.

perturbation.original_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement is subject in all respects to the terms and conditions of the Asset Purchase Agreement and is intended only to document the assignment of the Assigned Intellectual Property. Nothing contained in this Intellectual Property Agreement shall be deemed to supersede any of the obligations, agreements, representations, covenants or warranties of Seller and Buyer contained in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement is subject in all respects to the terms and conditions of the Asset Purchase Agreement and is intended only to document the assignment of the Assigned Intellectual Property. Nothing contained in this Intellectual Property Agreement shall be deemed to supersede any of the obligations, agreements, representations, covenants or warranties of Seller and Transferee contained in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Buyer' is replaced with 'Transferee' in the clause. The document now presents ambiguity regarding who the agreement benefits: the original 'Buyer', or this undefined 'Transferee'.
